service.description: Choose the Web3 services to power the infrastructure behind your Web3 project and build using simple APIs, CLI, or SDK by Apillon. Launch a service, receive API keys and start building your next Web3 project.

airdrop.name: NFT Brand Booster
airdrop.description: Send NFTs via email or wallets. Build a whitelist, reward the most loyal users, grow your email list in exchange for rewards, or hand-pick who gets the drop.

content.title: About
content.p: Boost your visibility and grow your community with collectible NFTs.
Use this Simplet to drop branded NFTs that double as rewards, access passes, or referral incentives. Send them to emails or allow pre-approved wallets to mint—no technical setup required.

content.subtitle: How it works
content.p: Brand Booster gives you two ways to distribute NFTs:
content: Email Mint: Upload email addresses to send mint invites—perfect for onboarding newcomers.
Wallet Mint: Upload a wallet list to let selected users mint directly—ideal for loyalty rewards or whitelisted drops.

content.content: Manage everything through the admin dashboard and track who minted what.

content.subtitle: What you’ll need before you start:
content: Create an NFT collection using Apillon’s step-by-step [NFT Wizard](/dashboard/service/nft), keeping in mind that attendees will mint from that collection.
If you're using email, you’ll need your [SMTP]() details so you can send invies directly from your domain.

content.subtitle: What it’s made of:
content: Frontend: Built with Vue.js
Backend: Powered by Node.js and MySQL for data storage
Employs: Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) to keep your SMTP credentials safe

content.subtitle: How to deploy:
content: Frontend: Use Apillon GitHub integration for a quick auto-deploy directly from the [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting). You can also run it locally or host it with any provider.

Backend: Use Phala Docker for a secure auto-deploy. You can also run it locally or with Docker—just configure your NFT and email setup [(see instructions on GitHub)](https://github.com/Apillon/nft-studio-simplet)

free-mint.name: NFT Wild West
free-mint.description: First-come-first-served NFTs. Run bold, experimental campaigns. Use memes, mystery, or chaos to go viral - and reward the fastest fingers.

poap.name: NFT Event Experience
poap.description: Easy to claim, fun to keep. Create digital badges for your event attendees. Drop NFTs at the event or online and let people collect proof they attented.

collection.empty: To get started, you’ll need at least one NFT collection in Apillon. Each Simplet needs a collection to work with—it’s where the NFTs will be minted, managed, and sent from.
collection.first: You don’t have any NFT collections yet. To continue, create one in Apillon first.
collection.info: Each Simplet needs an NFT collection to work with—it’s where the NFTs will be minted, managed, and sent from.

deployed.title: Boom. Simplet ready.
deployed.info: Now let’s decide how you want to spread the NFT love.
deployed.domain: Prefer a custom domain? Let’s spark it up.
deployed.addDomain:
Don’t let a random link steal your thunder. 
Add your own domain anytime in {0}.

smtp.info: Add your SMTP settings so your emails are sent straight from your domain—no sketchy senders here.
smtp.skip: Skip email server setup for now. A default SMTP server will be pre-configured inside the Docker image. You can update the SMTP configuration later if needed.
smtp.warning: Don’t worry—your SMTP details are safe. Simplets run in a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE), which means your sensitive data stays protected. Learn more about TEEs and confidential computing.

wizard.info: You’re about to deploy a Simplet that sets up your NFT distribution dashboard. Here, you’ll manage everything—email drops, wallet airdrops, public minting, and more.

simplet.includedServices: Web3 services, included in the Simplet:
